Package ohos.security.permission

Class PermissionFlags

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.security.permission.PermissionFlags

  • public final class PermissionFlags
extends Object
    Defines the set of markup states for permissions.
    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Security.Permission

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int PERMISSION_APPLY_RESTRICTION_FLAG
      Permission status: Permissions are disabled, but may be granted.
      static int PERMISSION_FLAGS_ALL_MASK
      Indicates the mask of all authority status.
      static int PERMISSION_GRANTED_BY_DEFAULT_FLAG
      Permission status: This permission is granted by default because it enables out-of-the-box application functionality and provides a smooth user experience.
      static int PERMISSION_GRANTED_BY_ROLE_FLAG
      Permission status: The application has a role and is granted with permissions.
      static int PERMISSION_POLICY_FIXED_FLAG
      Permission status: The permission status is set by the device policy and cannot be modified by the application or user.
      static int PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_ANY_EXEMPT_FLAGS
      Status of a permission that allows exemption from restricted permissions.
      static int PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_INSTALLER_EXEMPT_FLAG
      Permission status: This permission is restricted, but the application is unrestricted and allows the full form of the permission to be held, with exemptions documented by the installer.
      static int PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_SYSTEM_EXEMPT_FLAG
      Permission status: Permissions are restricted but not limited.
      static int PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_UPGRADE_EXEMPT_FLAG
      Permission status: The permission is restricted, but the application is not restricted.
      static int PERMISSION_REVIEW_REQUIRED_FLAG
      Permission status: Permissions must be audited before any application component runs.
      static int PERMISSION_REVOKE_ON_UPGRADE_FLAG
      Permission status: Permissions are set to be granted,but access to the resources it protects is otherwise restricted to revoke permissions on legacy applications that do not support runtime permissions.
      static int PERMISSION_REVOKE_WHEN_REQUESTED_FLAG
      Permission status: The permission is not explicitly applied for by the app, but is automatically added by the system.
      static int PERMISSION_SYSTEM_FIXED_FLAG
      Permission status: The permission is set to the current status because the application is a part of the system.
      static int PERMISSION_USER_FIXED_FLAG
      Permission status: The permission is set by the user to the current status and it is fixed.
      static int PERMISSION_USER_SENSITIVE_WHEN_DENIED_FLAG
      Permission status: Permission usage should be highly visible to users when denied.
      static int PERMISSION_USER_SENSITIVE_WHEN_GRANTED_FLAG
      Permission status: When granting permissions, you should make the user's use highly visible.
      static int PERMISSION_USER_SET_FLAG
      Permission status: This permission is set by the user and can still be requested by the application at runtime.

    • Field Detail

      • PERMISSION_APPLY_RESTRICTION_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_APPLY_RESTRICTION_FLAG
        Permission status: Permissions are disabled, but may be granted. If disabled, permission-protected data should be protected against no-operations (empty list, default error, etc.) rather than crashing the client.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_FLAGS_ALL_MASK

        public static final int PERMISSION_FLAGS_ALL_MASK
        Indicates the mask of all authority status.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_GRANTED_BY_DEFAULT_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_GRANTED_BY_DEFAULT_FLAG
        Permission status: This permission is granted by default because it enables out-of-the-box application functionality and provides a smooth user experience. For example, the mobile app needs to obtain the mobile phone permission.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_GRANTED_BY_ROLE_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_GRANTED_BY_ROLE_FLAG
        Permission status: The application has a role and is granted with permissions.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_POLICY_FIXED_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_POLICY_FIXED_FLAG
        Permission status: The permission status is set by the device policy and cannot be modified by the application or user.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_ANY_EXEMPT_FLAGS

        public static final int PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_ANY_EXEMPT_FLAGS
        Status of a permission that allows exemption from restricted permissions.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_INSTALLER_EXEMPT_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_INSTALLER_EXEMPT_FLAG
        Permission status: This permission is restricted, but the application is unrestricted and allows the full form of the permission to be held, with exemptions documented by the installer.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_SYSTEM_EXEMPT_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_SYSTEM_EXEMPT_FLAG
        Permission status: Permissions are restricted but not limited. The system provides permissions based on the permission policy.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_UPGRADE_EXEMPT_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_RESTRICTION_UPGRADE_EXEMPT_FLAG
        Permission status: The permission is restricted, but the application is not restricted. The permission is allowed. When the OS version is upgraded from an OS without permission restriction to an OS with permission restriction, the system provides the permission exemption.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_REVIEW_REQUIRED_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_REVIEW_REQUIRED_FLAG
        Permission status: Permissions must be audited before any application component runs.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_REVOKE_ON_UPGRADE_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_REVOKE_ON_UPGRADE_FLAG
        Permission status: Permissions are set to be granted,but access to the resources it protects is otherwise restricted to revoke permissions on legacy applications that do not support runtime permissions. If the application update supports the runtime permission, the permission is upgraded to the runtime permission. During the upgrade, the permission is revoked.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_REVOKE_WHEN_REQUESTED_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_REVOKE_WHEN_REQUESTED_FLAG
        Permission status: The permission is not explicitly applied for by the app, but is automatically added by the system. Once the application explicitly requests it, it undoes it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_SYSTEM_FIXED_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_SYSTEM_FIXED_FLAG
        Permission status: The permission is set to the current status because the application is a part of the system.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_USER_FIXED_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_USER_FIXED_FLAG
        Permission status: The permission is set by the user to the current status and it is fixed. That is, the application cannot request the permission any more.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_USER_SENSITIVE_WHEN_DENIED_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_USER_SENSITIVE_WHEN_DENIED_FLAG
        Permission status: Permission usage should be highly visible to users when denied.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_USER_SENSITIVE_WHEN_GRANTED_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_USER_SENSITIVE_WHEN_GRANTED_FLAG
        Permission status: When granting permissions, you should make the user's use highly visible.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_USER_SET_FLAG

        public static final int PERMISSION_USER_SET_FLAG
        Permission status: This permission is set by the user and can still be requested by the application at runtime.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
